meanings.definition: A diverse group of small proteins that are important in cell signaling.
meanings.sent1: The cytokines helped the cells communicate with each other.
meanings.sent2: The immune system releases cytokines to send messages to other cells.
meanings.sent3: The cytokines had a party to signal the cells in the body.
meanings.sent4: Like messengers, cytokines deliver important information between cells.
meanings.sent5: The cytokines acted like tiny couriers, delivering vital messages to neighboring cells.

meanings.definition: Proteins that are secreted by cells of the immune system and have an effect on other cells.
meanings.sent1: Cytokines from the immune system can influence nearby cells.
meanings.sent2: The effect of cytokines on cells is crucial for immune responses.
meanings.sent3: The immune system's cytokines threw a surprise party for the neighboring cells.
meanings.sent4: In a symphony of immunity, cytokines play the role of conductors directing cell responses.
meanings.sent5: The cytokines worked like tiny influencers, shaping the behavior of surrounding cells.
